feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 8:53AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... Despite diminishing winds, northwesterly winds up to 25 mph are resuspending ash from the 1912 Katmai-Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk and Larsen Bay are most likely to be impacted. Ash is currently north of Akhiok, but ash may mix south to the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 6:11AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...TRACE ASHFALL POSSIBLE ACROSS UNIMAK ISLAND... As of 1400Z or 6:00 AM AKDT Tuesday morning, satellite imagery detected an ongoing eruption of Shishaldin. Ash is being lofted up to 40,000 ft over Unimak Island with the plume moving to the south and west. Trace amounts of ashfall are possible for the community of False Pass.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 2:33AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Another round of snow for the Interior on Tuesday... Another round of snow showers is expected acros the Central Interior this morning and continuing into the afternoon. Snowfall totals of around 1 to 2 inches is expected for many locations. Heavy snow showers could reduce visibility at times. Please plan ahead for slippery road conditions and use caution when traveling.

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Fisheating Creek near Palmdale affecting Glades County. For the Fisheating Creek...including Palmdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 03 at 10:51AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... The Environmental Protection Commission of Hillsborough County has issued an Air Pollution Advisory due to elevated levels of fine particulates until midnight EDT tonight. Members of sensitive groups may experience adverse health effects. The general public is not likely to be affected.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 03 at 9:07AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall over or upstream from Astor, combined with northeast winds and high astronomical tides, have brought the Saint Johns River at Astor to Moderate Flood Stage. River levels are forecast to remain just above Moderate Flood Stage

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SMOKE FROM DISTANT CANADIAN WILDFIRES WILL IMPACT THE AREA... Surface observations and satellite images indicate that smoke being generated from wildfires in Canada continues to impact the area. Visibilities will generally range from 2 to 5 miles into this evening resulting in pockets of poor air quality across parts of Southeast Georgia and far southern South Carolina. This

entry.summary: ...SMOKE FROM DISTANT CANADIAN WILDFIRES WILL IMPACT THE AREA... entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 02 at 2:29PM MDT until October 03 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected, mainly above 8,000 feet. Snow accumulation will vary greatly with elevation.
